Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Nipple-Sparing Mastectomy Techniques with Immediate Prosthetic Breast Reconstruction

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Intervention.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of robotic (RNSM), conventional (CNSM), and endoscope-assisted nipple-sparing mastectomy (ENSM) combined with immediate prosthetic breast reconstruction (IPBR) for breast cancer treatment.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of robotic (RNSM), conventional (CNSM), and endoscope-assisted nipple-sparing mastectomy (ENSM) combined with immediate prosthetic breast reconstruction (IPBR) for breast cancer treatment.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was incision length, measured immediately post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Result_Outcome.evidence: ENSM with IPBR resulted in a significantly smaller incision (WMD: -5.57 cm, 95% CI: -10.74 to -0.69) compared to CNSM.
